note.p: Birth: The Old Residence, York, Yorkshire, England (14 October 1827)
Burial: The old church within the grounds of the family estates at Nuneham, Oxfordshire
Education: Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1851), MA (1869). Inner Temple (admitted 1851)

Career: President of the Union, Cambridge (1849); called to the Bar (1854); QC (1866); Whewell Professor of International Law, Cambridge University (1869-1887); Solicitor General (1873); Home Secretary (1880-1885); Chancellor of the Exchequer (1886 and 1892-1895); MP for Oxford (1868-1880); MP for Derby (1880-1895); Leader of the House of Commons (1894); MP for Monmouthshire, West division (1895-1904); Leader, Liberal Party (resigned 1898); Honorary Fellow, Cambridge University (1902)
References: Vanity Fair 04 June 1870, 30 November 1893 (group), 01 December 1898, 11 May 1899
